tool.name: ConsensusID
tool.description: Computes a consensus of peptide identifications of several identification engines.
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in && ${ ' '.join(["ln -s '%s' 'in/%s.%s' &&" % (_, re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', _.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(_.ext)) for _ in $in if _]) } mkdir out &&
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in ${' '.join(["'in/%s.%s'"%(re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', _.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(_.ext)) for _ in $in if _])} -out 'out/output.${in[0].ext}'
## Postprocessing && mv 'out/output.${in[0].ext}' '$out' #if "ctd_out_FLAG" in $OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.name: rt_delta
param.label: [idXML input only] Maximum allowed retention time deviation between identifications belonging to the same spectrum

param.name: mz_delta
param.label: [idXML input only] Maximum allowed precursor m/z deviation between identifications belonging to the same spectrum

param.name: per_spectrum
param.label: (only idXML) if set, mapping will be done based on exact matching of originating mzml file and spectrum_ref

param.name: algorithm
param.label: Algorithm used for consensus scoring
param.help: * PEPMatrix: Scoring based on posterior error probabilities (PEPs) and peptide sequence similarities (scored by a substitution matrix). Requires PEPs as scores.. * PEPIons: Scoring based on posterior error probabilities (PEPs) and fragment ion similarities ('shared peak count'). Requires PEPs as scores.. * best: For each peptide ID, use the best score of any search engine as the consensus score. Requires the same score type in all ID runs.. * worst: For each peptide ID, use the worst score of any search engine as the consensus score. Requires the same score type in all ID runs.. * average: For each peptide ID, use the average score of all search engines as the consensus. Requires the same score type in all ID runs.. * ranks: Calculates a consensus score based on the ranks of peptide IDs in the results of different search engines. The final score is in the range (0, 1], with 1 being the best score. No requirements about score types

param.name: considered_hits
param.label: The number of top hits in each ID run that are considered for consensus scoring ('0' for all hits)

param.name: min_support
param.label: For each peptide hit from an ID run, the fraction of other ID runs that must support that hit (otherwise it is removed)

param.name: count_empty
param.label: Count empty ID runs
param.help: (i.e. those containing no peptide hit for the current spectrum) when calculating 'min_support'?

param.name: keep_old_scores
param.label: if set, keeps the original scores as user params

param.name: mass_tolerance
param.label: Maximum difference between fragment masses (in Da) for fragments to be considered 'shared' between peptides

param.name: min_shared
param.label: The minimal number of 'shared' fragments (between two suggested peptides) that is necessary to evaluate the similarity based on shared peak count (SPC)

param.name: matrix
param.label: Substitution matrix to use for alignment-based similarity scoring

param.name: penalty
param.label: Alignment gap penalty (the same value is used for gap opening and extension)

param.name: test
param.label: Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

data.name: ctd_out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: ctd
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "ctd_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

tool.help:
Computes a consensus of peptide identifications of several identification engines.
For more information, visit http://www.openms.de/doxygen/release/2.6.0/html/TOPP_ConsensusID.html
